message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of graph partitioning, which is a well-studied problem in computer science. The focus of the paper is on perfectly balanced graph partitioning, which is a variant of the problem where the goal is to partition the graph into equal-sized parts. This suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) sub-category. 

The paper proposes a novel local improvement scheme that encodes local searches into a model and maintains balance by applying a negative cycle detection algorithm. This suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. 

The paper uses a parallel multi-level evolutionary algorithm to tackle the problem, which suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. 

The paper also discusses balancing unbalanced solutions, which suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper presents experimental results that show that the proposed system is able to improve or reproduce most of the best known perfectly balanced partitioning results ever reported in the literature. This suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category.
